node.title: Day 8. Doylems and telepathy
node.excerpt:
0730 the team awakes, well Bowie and Dee did, Monkey’s been awake since four having had an entire family of seagulls camped on top of the rear skylight to his room. 0810 the team prepares to depart, however Daisy is still tired and refuses to kick over, after giving the tired old girl a bump …

node.title: Day 7 – Moist videos and Moy.
node.excerpt:
0700 team arise in digs at 29 Craig Street,Inverness (highly recommended) after a fine night of dining with Dee’s long time rally partner Alistair Tough and his good wife Carole. 0730 Dee checks the bikes over only to discover the seagulls who he inadvertently fed on day one in Dumfries have trailed us and expressed …

node.title: Day6 – Bowie’s female gene & Pansy
node.excerpt:
0600 an early rise for the 0745 ferry, in discussion Monkey and Dee have noted that Bowie sits back like a 50’s wife and allows us to make fools of ourselves. To day is to be the day of reckoning where the imbalance is addressed. To commence we collectively recall the following 1. More than …

node.title: Day 5 Weighty matter, booking blunders and Twatts.
node.excerpt:
0710 Monkey awakes Dee saying look out the window we’ve got a visitor. Dee with great expectations of scantily clad females arises and looks out the window seeing nothing but garden disappointedly says to Monkey what you on about. Monkey points to Perter Rabbit eating breakfast, Dee intimates Monkeys consumption of ladyboy tea on day …

node.excerpt:
0915 depart hotel and say farewell to Mrs Angela Monkhouse and her sister Carol, who had traveled as our logistics team to resupply the riders with clean underwater and takeaway used. Thanks ladies.  1000 Bowie gets some off road mountain climbing in. 1015 riding uphill in second gear Dee rides over a rut and Accidentally …

node.title: Day 3 Tickets and Wheelies
node.excerpt:
0715 Dee realises he hasn’t booked this mornings ferry to the Isle of Skye – frantic internet search then a knee trembling walk to ferry terminal where the kind young lady on the ticket desk sold him the required berths. 0745 Bowie with malice and premeditation vandalises the hotels tea pot a breakfast. 0800 Monkey …

node.title: Day 2 Vapours and Wheelies.
node.excerpt:
0755 Depart the hotel after breakfast which Dee demanded was eaten inside the restaurant to avoid potential seagull mugging. 0850 Arrive Adrossan ferry terminal in route yet again Monkey had to turn the fuel tap to reserve. At the required petrol station Bowie and Dee still had half a tank and agree Monkey’s bike has …

node.title: A chance encounter
node.excerpt:
last evening whilst eating our dinner on the hotel patio a fellow biker approached us and said are you the three on the Cub 50’s? We said yes that’s us, he explained he’d ridden from Kendal that morning stopping a Carlisle’s McDonald’s drive through for breakfast where the hostess had told him about us. Dee …

node.title: Monkey fettling his broken Cub and other day one images
Day One
node.excerpt:
An excellent first day albeit with some minor discretions, 160 miles ridden with the following events in order of occurrence. 0730 Depart Complete Engineering Services Ltd. 0800 Arrive Blood Bikes HQ at Port Road, Carlisle where Dee was interviewed by BBC Radio Cumbria. 0830ish depart Carlisle with a Blood Bikes Escort to the City limits …
